intro: Cerastium schmalhausenii, commonly known as the Schmalhausen’s mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its dense mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
